forkee.name: hivemind
forkee.description: Decentralized deep learning in PyTorch. Built to train models on thousands of volunteers across the world.

issue.title: Support for windows
issue.body:
Hi there. I wonder if you are planning on supporting windows.
I can use wsl and it runs fine ,but a more native version is better.

I see that uvloop library is not compatible with windows. Is it really that important to use it instead of good old asyncio?

forkee.name: hivemind-Decentralized-Ai
forkee.description: Decentralized deep learning in PyTorch. Built to train models on thousands of volunteers across the world.

issue.title: [BUG] Unable to start hivemind server when using gradient clipping
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to start up a hivemind server enabling gradient clipping `--clip_grad_norm` results in an error in https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/blob/master/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py due a setter property not being present for `defaults` in the file

**To Reproduce**
After starting up a dht peer, ran the following command:
Command:
`hivemind-server --expert_cls ffn --hidden_dim 512 --num_experts 5 --expert_pattern "expert.[0:5]" --initial_peers /ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY --clip_grad_norm 1.0`

Output:
```
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Running DHT node on ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s', '/ip4/127.0.0.1/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s'], initial peers = ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY']
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Generating 5 expert uids from pattern expert.[0:5]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/bin/hivemind-server", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
             ^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/hivemind_cli/run_server.py", line 105, in main
    server = Server.create(**args, optim_cls=optim_cls, start=True, compression=compression)
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/server.py", line 205, in create
    optimizer = ClippingWrapper(optimizer, clip_grad_norm)
                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 52, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 8, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim.param_groups, optim.defaults)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/torch/optim/optimizer.py", line 171, in __init__
    self.defaults = defaults
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: property 'defaults' of 'ClippingWrapper' object has no setter
```

**Environment**
Please list:
* python version: 3.11.5
* hivemind.commit id: https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/commit/28732521db96dd8e79e0a41e58979b163c7e6fc8
* Please copy and paste the output from pytorch [environment collection script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py)
```
Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 2.0.1+cu117
Is debug build: False
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 11.7
ROCM used to build PyTorch: N/A

OS: Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS (x86_64)
GCC version: (Ubuntu 11.4.0-1ubuntu1~22.04) 11.4.0
Clang version: Could not collect
CMake version: version 3.27.5
Libc version: glibc-2.35

Python version: 3.11.5 (main, Sep 11 2023, 13:54:46) [GCC 11.2.0] (64-bit runtime)

issue.title: [BUG] Unable to start hivemind server when using gradient clipping
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to start up a hivemind server enabling gradient clipping `--clip_grad_norm` results in an error in https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/blob/master/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py due a setter property not being present for `defaults` in the file

**To Reproduce**
After starting up a dht peer, ran the following command:
Command:
`hivemind-server --expert_cls ffn --hidden_dim 512 --num_experts 5 --expert_pattern "expert.[0:5]" --initial_peers /ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY --clip_grad_norm 1.0`

Output:
```
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Running DHT node on ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s', '/ip4/127.0.0.1/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s'], initial peers = ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY']
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Generating 5 expert uids from pattern expert.[0:5]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/bin/hivemind-server", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
             ^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/hivemind_cli/run_server.py", line 105, in main
    server = Server.create(**args, optim_cls=optim_cls, start=True, compression=compression)
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/server.py", line 205, in create
    optimizer = ClippingWrapper(optimizer, clip_grad_norm)
                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 52, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 8, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim.param_groups, optim.defaults)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/torch/optim/optimizer.py", line 171, in __init__
    self.defaults = defaults
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: property 'defaults' of 'ClippingWrapper' object has no setter
```

**Environment**
Please list:
* python version: 3.11.5
* hivemind.commit id: https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/commit/28732521db96dd8e79e0a41e58979b163c7e6fc8
* Please copy and paste the output from pytorch [environment collection script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py)
```
Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 2.0.1+cu117
Is debug build: False

ROCM used to build PyTorch: N/A

issue.title: [BUG] Unable to start hivemind server when using gradient clipping
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to start up a hivemind server enabling gradient clipping `--clip_grad_norm` results in an error in https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/blob/master/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py due a setter property not being present for `defaults` in the file

**To Reproduce**
After starting up a dht peer, ran the following command:
Command:
`hivemind-server --expert_cls ffn --hidden_dim 512 --num_experts 5 --expert_pattern "expert.[0:5]" --initial_peers /ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY --clip_grad_norm 1.0`

Output:
```
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Running DHT node on ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s', '/ip4/127.0.0.1/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s'], initial peers = ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY']
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Generating 5 expert uids from pattern expert.[0:5]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/bin/hivemind-server", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
             ^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/hivemind_cli/run_server.py", line 105, in main
    server = Server.create(**args, optim_cls=optim_cls, start=True, compression=compression)
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/server.py", line 205, in create
    optimizer = ClippingWrapper(optimizer, clip_grad_norm)
                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 52, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 8, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim.param_groups, optim.defaults)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/torch/optim/optimizer.py", line 171, in __init__
    self.defaults = defaults
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: property 'defaults' of 'ClippingWrapper' object has no setter
```

**Environment**
Please list:
* python version: 3.11.5
* hivemind.commit id: https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/commit/28732521db96dd8e79e0a41e58979b163c7e6fc8
* Please copy and paste the output from pytorch [environment collection script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py)
```

comment.body: Hi @SamAg19, the pull request #593 should have fixed this issue. Could you please try installing from master and confirm that?

issue.title: [BUG] Unable to start hivemind server when using gradient clipping
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to start up a hivemind server enabling gradient clipping `--clip_grad_norm` results in an error in https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/blob/master/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py due a setter property not being present for `defaults` in the file

**To Reproduce**
After starting up a dht peer, ran the following command:
Command:
`hivemind-server --expert_cls ffn --hidden_dim 512 --num_experts 5 --expert_pattern "expert.[0:5]" --initial_peers /ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY --clip_grad_norm 1.0`

Output:
```
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Running DHT node on ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s', '/ip4/127.0.0.1/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s'], initial peers = ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY']
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Generating 5 expert uids from pattern expert.[0:5]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/bin/hivemind-server", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
             ^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/hivemind_cli/run_server.py", line 105, in main
    server = Server.create(**args, optim_cls=optim_cls, start=True, compression=compression)
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/server.py", line 205, in create
    optimizer = ClippingWrapper(optimizer, clip_grad_norm)
                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 52, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 8, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim.param_groups, optim.defaults)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/torch/optim/optimizer.py", line 171, in __init__
    self.defaults = defaults
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: property 'defaults' of 'ClippingWrapper' object has no setter
```

issue.title: [BUG] Unable to start hivemind server when using gradient clipping
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to start up a hivemind server enabling gradient clipping `--clip_grad_norm` results in an error in https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/blob/master/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py due a setter property not being present for `defaults` in the file

**To Reproduce**
After starting up a dht peer, ran the following command:
Command:
`hivemind-server --expert_cls ffn --hidden_dim 512 --num_experts 5 --expert_pattern "expert.[0:5]" --initial_peers /ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY --clip_grad_norm 1.0`

Output:
```
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Running DHT node on ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s', '/ip4/127.0.0.1/tcp/38207/p2p/12D3KooWPEZEe796QZDZn8qCXXnC4RDxqkz6ADbAQ4fXLCeiMj5s'], initial peers = ['/ip4/172.29.152.117/tcp/45239/p2p/12D3KooWCAArT2ncW2H9BRoneEri4b2xh99SdMgXPZEuzkobx3bY']
Sep 28 17:55:49.317 [INFO] Generating 5 expert uids from pattern expert.[0:5]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/bin/hivemind-server", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
             ^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/hivemind_cli/run_server.py", line 105, in main
    server = Server.create(**args, optim_cls=optim_cls, start=True, compression=compression)
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/server.py", line 205, in create
    optimizer = ClippingWrapper(optimizer, clip_grad_norm)
                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 52, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/hivemind/moe/server/layers/optim.py", line 8, in __init__
    super().__init__(optim.param_groups, optim.defaults)
  File "/home/samag19/miniconda3/envs/py311/lib/python3.11/site-packages/torch/optim/optimizer.py", line 171, in __init__
    self.defaults = defaults
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: property 'defaults' of 'ClippingWrapper' object has no setter
```

**Environment**
Please list:
* python version: 3.11.5
* hivemind.commit id: https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/commit/28732521db96dd8e79e0a41e58979b163c7e6fc8
* Please copy and paste the output from pytorch [environment collection script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py)
```

pull_request.title: Fix OptimizerWrapper creation, test gradient clipping
pull_request.body:
Currently, OptimizerWrapper fails when creating an optimizer: it attempts to assign the property `defaults` which has no setter defined. The easiest way to address this is to remove inheritance from OptimizerWrapper while keeping the same API for functions required by hivemind.server: as this is an internal component, downstream users are unlikely to be negatively affected.

Fixes https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/issues/592

repo.name: hivemind
repo.description: Decentralized deep learning in PyTorch. Built to train models on thousands of volunteers across the world.

pull_request.title: Install setuptools+wheel in develop mode during CI
pull_request.body: In recent builds, pip started issuing an error when trying to pass `--no-use-pep517` without setuptools and wheel installed (see [this build](https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/actions/runs/6448925844/job/17506719837?pr=593#step:7:16) as an example). This PR addresses the issue by installing setuptools and wheel before calling `pip install`.

pull_request.title: Fix deprecations and update dependencies for examples/albert
pull_request.body: The current Docker build fails due to old versions of transformers/datasets depending on an old version of tokenizers, which does not compile in the current environment of the Docker image. The easiest way to address the issue appears to be the bump of dependencies. I have tested running the example on 2 peers with albert-base-v2, and the code runs and even starts to converge: Also, in recent builds, pip started issuing an error when trying to pass --no-use-pep517 without setuptools and wheel installed (see [this build](https://github.com/learning-at-home/hivemind/actions/runs/6448925844/job/17506719837?pr=593#step:7:16) as an example). This PR addresses the issue by installing setuptools and wheel before calling pip install.
